snippet: A project in Tupper Lake, N.Y., was approved after a nearly decade-long tug of war between environmentalists and pro-development residents.
abstract: Adirondack Park Agency approves a resort development on 6,300 acres in the Northern Adirondack town of Tupper Lake, NY; project, the Adirondack Club and Resort, will include more than 650 units of housing along with a hotel and recreation areas; approval comes after a nearly decade-long clash between environmentalists fearing a dangerous precedent and pro-development residents.
lead_paragraph: A project in Tupper Lake, N.Y., was approved after a nearly decade-long tug of war between environmentalists and pro-development residents.

headline.seo: In Struggling Tupper Lake, Resort Project Creates Rift
headline.main: In the Adirondacks, Joy and Fear Over What a Resort May Bring
headline.print_headline: In the Adirondacks, Joy and Fear Over What a Resort May Bring
